On Tue, 14 Aug 2001, <magnus@...> wrote:

> Not sure if this is the proper platform to ask questions about ant's
> JUnit task, but in lack of a better one, here goes:

ant-user@...?

> What I want to do is cause the build to fail if any JUnit tests
> fail.  However, even if one test fails, I want to continue running
> all the other tests, so that one test does not hide an error from
> another one.

Use Ant 1.4beta and make the task set a property on failure.  After
the junit task place a <fail> task that gets conditionally executed if
the property has been set.

There is no way to do what you want in Ant 1.3's <junit> task.

> 1 - Why are there two haltonfailure attributes?

To make it possible to have tests that are "OK to fail" while others
must pass.

Stefan
